head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 28/4/66. ¶ This day only, dear Sir George, I received the Opuntia with the ova of Coccus Cacti. I am not certain, whether not the period of transit was too long for the retentio...

div.p: Auckland Public Library, Grey papers, GL M50(9).

This day only, dear Sir George, I received the Opuntia with the ova of Coccus Cacti. I am not certain, whether not the period of transit was too long for the retention of vitality of the ova. As yet I have noticed no life in any of the maternal abdominal remnants; still the hatching process may yet commence. I shall pay every attention to this little treasure consigned by your Excellency to my care. I have several species of large Opuntiae under cultivation, so that the percentage of pigment obtainable from insects reared on different species may be ascertained. I will report progress to your Excellency. I had the pleasure to meet Dr M'Kinnon, with whose brother I am particularly befriended.
Dr William Alexander Mackinnon and Lauchlan Mackinnon. Since Dr MacKinnon evinces a warm interest in acclimation-pursuits, I shall be able to secure his kind attention to some small contributions destined for your Excellencys during the voyage.
